original: DUHS, Gustaf Hugo Reinhold, Generalkonsul, Djursholm, f Hagfors, Vrml, 16/6 78 av ing G D o Emilie Löfgren, gm Greta Hjorth. Studex, civ.ing. Anst AB Arehns Mek Verkst Sthlm 02—09, ^B B A Hjorth sed. 10. Gen.kons f Monaco sed. 14. Ordf i Corps Consulaire, dir.led i Wenner-Grenska institutet,’ Styr.ordf AB B A Hjorth & Co, AB Primus, AB Enköpings Verkst, Inst f be-kämp av mutor o bestickn, Sällsk SBK mm. Resor: Sydam 23, Asien 24, 31, Afr 19, 24, 25, 27, 28, 29, 31, Tyskl, Holl, Belg. Frankr, Engl, Ital fi ggr. KVO2kl, KFinlVRO, KLettSO, KMonS :tCO, KTunNI, OffBKrO, OffFrllL, OffNedONO; KAK, KMK, KSSS, KSAK, Sthlms Isjaktklb, Sthlms Yachtklb, Sv Tekn.frn, Sthlms Köpm.klb, W6, Stadsbildskåren, Travellers club, ett f ler t frn f idrott, konst, kultur, internat samarb osv.
translated: DUHS, Gustaf Hugo Reinhold, Honorary Consul General, Djursholm, born in Hagfors, Värmland, on June 16, 1878, to parents Gustav David and Emilie Löfgren. Married to Greta Hjorth. Graduated, engineer. Employed at AB Arehns Mechanical Workshop in Stockholm from 1902 to 1909, and later at B. A. Hjorth & Co. Became Honorary Consul in Monaco in 1914. Chairman of the Corps Consulaire and board member of Wenner-Gren Institute. Chairman of AB B. A. Hjorth & Co., AB Primus, and AB Enköpings Mechanical Works. Member of the Institute for Combating Bribery and Corruption, Society of Business and Culture, and other organizations. Traveled extensively to South America (1923), Asia (1924, 1931), Africa (1919, 1924, 1925, 1927, 1928, 1929, 1931), Germany, Holland, Belgium, France, England, Italy, and others. Recipient of several decorations: Knight Second Class of the Royal Order of Vasa, Knight of the Order of the White Rose of Finland, Knight First Class of the Order of Three Stars of Latvia, Commander of the Order of St. Charles of Monaco, Knight of the Order of St. Olav of Norway, Officer of the Order of the Crown of Belgium, Officer of the Legion of Honour of France, Officer of the Order of Orange-Nassau of the Netherlands. Member of the Royal Academy of Fine Arts, the Royal Swedish Academy of Music, the Royal Society of Sea Rescue, the Stockholm Ice Yachting Club, the Stockholm Yacht Club, the Swedish Association of Engineers, the Stockholm Merchant Club, and others. Also involved in sports, arts, culture, and international cooperation.
